title: Fix release workflow vsce verification failure
description:
The release workflow fails at the 'Verify package' step which runs 'vsce ls'. This command internally runs 'npm list --production' which checks all production dependencies. The @opentui/core and @opentui/react packages have peer dependencies (@types/bun, @types/three, @types/react-reconciler) that aren't installed, causing the verification to fail.

Root cause: OpenTUI packages were incorrectly listed as production dependencies when they're only used by the CLI (which is compiled into standalone binaries by Bun).

Fix:
1. Move @opentui/core and @opentui/react from dependencies to devDependencies (correct since CLI is compiled)
2. Remove the 'vsce ls' verification step (redundant given --no-dependencies flag on vsce package)

GitHub Actions run: https://github.com/raychaser/beadsx/actions/runs/20554711708/job/59037246225
close_reason: Fixed by moving OpenTUI to devDependencies and removing vsce ls step

No maximum limit on auto-reload interval
description:
MEDIUM: User can set autoReloadInterval to very small values causing excessive CPU usage.

Location: beadsTreeDataProvider.ts:101, package.json:72-77

Root cause: package.json has minimum: 0 but no maximum. User could set interval to 0.1s causing 600+ refreshes per minute.

Fix: Add maximum in package.json and validate in code:
```json
"beadsx.autoReloadInterval": {
  "type": "number",
  "default": 10,
  "minimum": 0,
  "maximum": 3600,
  "description": "Interval in seconds (0 to disable, max 1 hour)"
}
```

Also add code validation:
```typescript
const intervalSeconds = Math.min(config.get('autoReloadInterval', 10), 3600);
```
close_reason: Added maximum 3600s in both package.json and code validation with clamping
